variant.question: ICAO ANNEX 6 defines a Commercial Air Transport operation as:

options.text: an aircraft operation involving the transport of passengers, cargo or mail for remuneration or hire.
an aircraft operation to transport passengers for remuneration or other valuable consideration.
any operation of an aircraft in return for remuneration or other valuable consideration.
an aircraft operation to transport passengers, cargo or mail.

variant.question: A flight with a Swedish registered aircraft is performing domestic air services in Germany with a French nationality crew and operation on an Italian AOC. Which state is defined as the competent authority?

options.text: Italy
France
Sweden
Germany

variant.question: ICAO Annex 6 part 3 is applicable to operators authorised to conduct

options.text: international commercial air transport operations or international general aviation operations, with helicopters
commercial air transport operations
international general aviation operations with aeroplanes
international commercial air transport operations with aeroplanes
an aircraft operation to transport passengers, cargo or mail for remuneration or other valuable consideration.
an aircraft operation to transport passengers, cargo or mail for remuneration.
an operation to transport passengers, cargo or mail for remuneration or other valuable consideration by air or on the ground.
an aircraft operation to transport passengers and cargo for remuneration or other valuable consideration.

variant.question: What is correct regarding the fuel policy for PART-CAT?

options.text: Extra fuel is the only definition where you can add fuel for 2-3 go-arounds at destination due to forecasted high crosswind.
Final reserve is 45 minutes at 1 500 ft AAL for a turbine aircraft.
Taxi fuel shall always be a minimum of 200 kg.
The procedure RCF is only to be used in minimum required fuel situations.

variant.question: ICAO Annex 6 Part I is applicable to:

options.text: International Commercial Air Transport - Aeroplanes
International Commercial Air Transport - Helicopters
International Operations - Aeroplanes & Helicopters
International General Aviation - Aeroplanes

variant.question: Which of the following is the correct definition of commercial air transport operation according to ICAO Annex 6, Part I / Part III?

options.text: An aircraft operation involving the transport of passengers, cargo or mail for remuneration or hire.
An aircraft operation by a commercial operator for or without remuneration or hire.

An aircraft operation in which an aircraft is used for specialised services such as agriculture, construction, photography, surveying, observation and patrol, search and rescue, aerial advertisement, etc.
Any aircraft operation for remuneration or hire.

variant.question: Which ICAO annex is applicable to regulations regarding aeroplane commercial air transport operations?

options.text: Annex 6
Annex 5
Annex 2
Annex 1

variant.question: Which of the following activities is applicable to helicopters engaged in Commercial Air Transportation?

options.text: Flights in which passengers are transported from A to B without participating in the operation of the flight
Flights in which up to 6 persons indispensable to an aerial photography activity are transported from A to B
Search and rescue
Crop spraying

variant.question:
An EU CAT Operator (Operator 1) has dry-leased in an aeroplane from another EU Operator (Operator 2) and the aeroplane has been given a national registration by the Competent Authority.
Due to Operational reasons, the aeroplane has to  enter service sooner than planned. When the pilots programme the FMS for the first flight it becomes apparent that the FMS navigation database is that of Operator 2. The flight....

options.text: can only commence if the database has been updated with one normally used by Operator 1.
may commence as planned provided the FMS navigation database is not used as the primary means of navigating.
can only commence once the FMS database has been approved by the competent Authority of Operator 1 and EASA.
may commence as planned provided the required FMS navigation data are current and procedures available.

variant.question: The Standards and Recommended Practices contained in ICAO Annex 6, Part I, are applicable to..

options.text: the operation of aeroplanes by operators authorised to conduct international commercial air transport operations.
all aeroplanes and helicopters engaged in international general aviation operations.
all aeroplanes and helicopters engaged in international commercial air transport operations.
all international general aviation aeroplane operations, including large aeroplanes, turbojet aeroplanes, and corporate aviation operations.

variant.question:
An operator is performing CAT non-scheduled flights in Spain with an aircraft dry-leased from an owner resident in Greece. The operator has its principal place of business in Austria. The flight crew and cabin crew hold Part-FCL licences and attestations, respectively, issued by Finland.
According to EU OPS regulations, the Member State which shall designate the Competent Authority responsible for the oversight of this operation is:

options.text: Austria
Finland
Spain
Greece

variant.question: An operator is performing CAT scheduled flights in Germany with a flight crew holding Part-FCL licences issued by France, the cabin crew hold attestations issued by Sweden, and the operator has its principal place of business in Italy. According to OPS regulations, what Member State shall designate the Competent Authority responsible for the oversight of this operation?

options.text: Italy
Germany
Sweden
France
